title: No apparent activity after snapshots verification + crash
body:
v2.47.0, syncing a brand new mainnet node + caplin

After finishing torrent download + verification, there was no more logs, only caplin idle logs, but IIRC at that time there should be torrent indexing.

if that's the case, I think a possible improvement is to have a ticker log so we know what is happening:

```
INFO[06-28|02:28:21.362] [snapshots] Verify                       progress=91.85%
INFO[06-28|02:28:41.364] [snapshots] Verify                       progress=95.21%

B

INFO[06-28|02:32:19.683] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth68=100 eth66=4 eth67=29
INFO[06-28|02:32:21.348] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=2587 alloc=9.3GB sys=12.8
GB
```

After a few minutes, the node crashed:

```
INFO[06-28|02:48:21.347] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=2587 alloc=7.2GB sys=13.8
GB
INFO[06-28|02:48:41.854] [Caplin] P2P                             peers=33
./run-erigon2-gcloud.sh: line 14: 36362 Killed                  ~/erigon/build/bin/erigon --datadir /mnt/erigon --http
 --http.api "eth,net,web3,erigon,debug,txpool,trace,ots" --ws --http.corsdomain "*" --http.addr "0.0.0.0" --http.vhost
s '*' --authrpc.addr "0.0.0.0" --authrpc.vhosts '*' --internalcl --rpc.batch.limit 500
```

not sure why, but I guess out of memory maybe? Using a 16GB machine (c2-standard-4 on gcloud).

I restarted the process and there are no logs again, but I can see on htop CPUs are all busy, so I guess the ticker log suggestion holds + should the 16GB memory requirement be revisited in docs maybe?
